subhead: After the fall of Prime Minister François Bayrou, no one is in a position to guarantee a way out of France's social, political and budgetary crises, writes Le Monde columnist Françoise Fressoz.

title: Elon Musk: The $1 trillion man?

title: Alison Bechdel, cartoonist: 'How can you argue with people who don't use logic?'
subhead: In 'Spent: A Comic Novel,' Bechdel depicts a queer community under siege by Trumpism, with self-deprecating humor. The Cartoonmuseum Basel in Switzerland is dedicating a retrospective to her work through October 26.

Fashion retreats from diversity: 'We are again being openly asked for Caucasian models'
subhead: Until recently, the industry enthusiastically embraced the major social issues stirring society. From supporting Pride to Black Lives Matter, to championing inclusivity in the representation of bodies and identities, fashion seemed in tune with the times. But the tide has turned. The election of Donald Trump, who issued a series of anti-diversity executive orders, has changed everything.
byline: By Sophie Abriat and Valentin Pérez

title: Putin's eternally inscrutable diplomacy
subhead: Between fake diplomatic overtures in Alaska and real military offensives in Ukraine, the Kremlin has maintained its ambiguity and heightened Europeans' concerns.

title: Did Macron really add €1 trillion to France's national debt?
subhead: While this figure often cited by opposition parties is misleading, France's debt has risen significantly under Emmanuel Macron's presidency, partly due to his tax policy decisions.
